name: Weaving A Story - A curated exploration of Kanjivaram silks through stories and sarees
description:
Join us for a curated storytelling morning - Weaving a story (A curated exploration of Kanjivaram silks through stories and sarees)
Aparna Jaishankar will delve into stories of the symbolic significance of the vibrant colours and intricate motifs, from the royal gold threads to the lush temple borders.
Moreover, Atta Galatta’s Co-Founder, Lakshmi Sankar’s private collection of sarees will be on display. She will be sharing snippets of the generational journey of these elegant weaves.
Whether you're a lover of textiles, mythology, or just fascinated by Indian heritage, this event will wrap you in the magic of tradition

name: Queer Quiet Hours - Meetup
description:
Queer Quiet Hours: After a wonderful first meetup, we’re back with our second session! This is a space to unplug and create together—no agenda, no pressure. Draw, paint, read, or just sit and reflect. Whether you talk about art, music, or stay quiet, it’s all welcome here.
There are 15 spots available, and this meetup is exclusively for LGBTQIA+ folks.
 Allies are welcome too, as long as they join with a queer friend who can vouch for them. Neurospicy and neurotypical folks are both welcome. 🌈🎨

name: In Pursuit of Freedom - Book Talk
description:
Embark on a resplendent journey alongside acclaimed writer Pradeep Damodaran, as he follows the fault lines of freedom and independence in contemporary India and paints a vivid portrait of a nation in flux.
Damodaran travels the length and breadth of the country--from places that played an important role in the Independence movement, such as Sabarmati, Dandi and Jhansi, to sites of contemporary significance, like Nandigram, Unnao and Kudankulam--meeting survivors of riots, descendants of freedom fighters, social workers, environmental activists, farmers and ordinary citizens to discover what freedom means to them.
A genre-bending book, In Pursuit of Freedom touches upon several critical issues--religion, economic disparity, gender, environment, politics--as it blends travelogue and memoir, history and current affairs. Spectacular and insightful, this on-the-ground narrative of today's India is a must-read. Join us for an introduction to the man behind the book, as Pradeep will be hosting a talk based on his work at Atta Galatta on 6th October at 3.30 PM!

name: Perspective Drawing Secrets - Drawing Workshop
description:
Perspective Drawing for Everyone
Join us for a fun and exciting workshop called "Perspective Drawing for Everyone"! This event is perfect for all levels who want to learn how to turn 2D sketches into 3D.
Why It's Important:

Create Realistic Art: Learn how to make your drawings look real and three-dimensional. Imagine drawing a road that looks like it stretches far into the distance or a building that looks tall and grand. Perspective drawing makes your art pop off the page!
Boost Your Imagination: Perspective drawing helps you bring your creative ideas to life. Whether you're designing a cool cityscape or a fantasy world, understanding perspective will make your drawings more believable and exciting.
Impress Your Friends: Imagine showing your friends a drawing of a skateboard park that looks like you could step right into it! Learning perspective will make your artwork stand out and impress everyone who sees it.
Have Fun with Art: Most importantly, perspective drawing is fun! You'll get to experiment with different techniques, learn new skills, and enjoy creating amazing artwork.

Join us for "Perspective Drawing for Everyone" and discover the magic of making your drawings come to life!
What will be provided?

All the needed materials will be provided
Ste-by-step instructions to get acquainted with the concepts

Mentor

Raju Dyapur (worldofpaintings.com) has been teaching Fine Art and Vedic Mathematics for more than 6 years and conducting workshops in India since 2014. His experience in drawing/fine art comes from his learning in school and college and the training he got from private lessons in Russia.
His artworks are in private collections in UK, Middle East, USA, Canada, Russia and Singapore and conducted hundreds of workshops across the nation and abroad.
Raju Dyapur was selected as one of the artists for WTC The Hague Art Gallery, Netherlands

name: Crafting Your Ikigai Blueprint - Wellness Workshop
description:
Atta Galatta and Dr. Divyanshi warmly invite you to a transformative journey of self-discovery through this Ikigai workshop.
True Ikigai is much deeper than the simplified, westernized diagram you may have seen. It’s not just about the intersection of what you love, what you’re good at, and what pays the bills—it’s a profound connection to life itself. It’s a sense of purpose that transcends personal fulfillment and speaks to the joy of simply being alive, regardless of circumstances. In this Ikigai Workshop, you’ll dive beyond the surface-level interpretations to explore the authentic essence of Ikigai, rooted in Japanese culture and philosophy.
Throughout the workshop, you’ll be guided through reflective exercises, guided meditations, introspective prompts and insightful discussions to explore the core elements of your purpose. Whether you feel stuck in your current routine, are searching for new directions, or simply want to live a more fulfilling life, this workshop will help you identify your personal Ikigai. Through self-reflection, guided activities, and group sharing, you’ll leave with clarity on how to live with intention, satisfaction, and a renewed sense of direction.

Who Should Attend? 
This workshop is perfect for anyone seeking more clarity and purpose in life. Whether you're navigating career transitions, looking for personal fulfillment, or simply curious about the Ikigai philosophy, this workshop is open to anyone aged 16 and above. No prior experience or background is needed.

Workshop Objectives:
- To guide participants in understanding and applying the Ikigai framework in their lives.
- To encourage self-reflection on passions, skills, and values.
- To provide tools for aligning life choices with deeper purpose.
- To create a supportive space for personal growth and sharing insights.

Community Guidelines:
- Be open, be civil, be kind.
- Listen with respect and speak with intention.
- Keep the conversation constructive and supportive.

ONLY 7 SEATS AVAILABLE
We aim to create an intimate and focused experience, ensuring personalized attention, deeper discussions, and space for meaningful reflection.

name: Support Group - Support Group
description:
Topic: A discussion on chapter 1 & 2 from the book "Attached"; Decoding relationship behavior, Dependency is not a bad word.
The book "Attached” will be available at the bookstore for purchase.
People make up big cities but what makes up people’s lives, hopefully not loneliness. Loneliness is an intensely painful state which arises out of lack of intimacy and connectedness. People from every wake of life, even those with social contacts or pursuing successful careers can experience sadness from absence of belongingness. This painful experience is felt in a myriad of contexts such as breakups, disagreeing families, fear of rejection, unrelatability, shyness and so on.
This support group has been constituted to bring people struggling with disconnectedness in various contexts together for a shared experience of comfort, belongingness, laughter, guidance and above all to break the cycle of sustained loneliness.
The support is being organized and moderated by Nimesh George Mphil PhD who is a practicing psychologist based in Bangalore.This session will be co-moderated by Nimesh George & Gokul R, who are both practising psychologists in Bangalore.

name: Wandering Thoughts - Reflection Circle - Women's Support Group
description:
Atta Galatta and fallenphoenix2fly warmly invite you to our Women Support Group Meet, a safe and supportive gathering dedicated to providing emotional support and fostering a sense of community among women. Join us for an evening of connection, sharing, and mutual support in the comforting ambiance of our library café. This event is designed to create a judgment-free zone where women can be themselves and share their experiences openly.
Event Structure:
Introduction Session: Participants introduce themselves to the group.
Icebreaker Game: A fun and engaging game to help participants get familiar with each other.
Listening Session: Each participant is given the opportunity to share what they are going through. This segment emphasizes silent support, without offering advice, to create a safe and non-judgmental space.
Positive Action Segment: After the emotional sharing session, we engage in an uplifting activity to provide positive reinforcement and soothe the soul.
Community Guidelines:
- Be open, be civil, be courteous, be kind, and have fun.
- Listen more. Speak mindfully.
- Respect each other`s experiences and maintain confidentiality.
- Provide silent support and refrain from offering unsolicited advice.
- While one person is sharing their story, participants should refrain from interrupting. We will allow each person to share in turn, and if anyone wishes to respond or provide support, they will have their chance during their turn.

name: Polaroids - Life In Snapshots - Book Launch
description:
We are delighted to invite you to the launch of Shivangi Jain’s debut book, Polaroids – Life in Snapshots. Shivangi, a psychologist, writer, and creative powerhouse, invites you to experience life’s fleeting moments captured in her stunning collection of poems.
The evening will begin with the official book launch, followed by an exclusive author interview conducted by Swathi Shetty, filmmaker and founder of Elderworld. The event will wrap up with a book signing and audience interaction, accompanied by light refreshments.

name: Food In Indian Literature - Monthly Book Club
description:
Our emotions and memories are intrinsically related to the food we eat and the genre of food literature combines them in a way that helps us connect not only to our past and our present, to different cultures, and communities, values and rituals, events both life-changing and mundane but to each other as well.
So, if viewing the world through the lens of food and literature interests you, then join us to begin a dialogue on “Food in Indian Literature” and to celebrate those stories and their diversity. Each month with Prachi Grover, we will be reading our way through several powerful (and delicious) narratives.
October Read: A Touch of Salt by Anita Agnihotri. Translated by Arunava Sinha
We assure you that you will relish every single bite!
The session is free but registration is a must as we have limited spots available.
Prachi Grover is a culinary consultant and educator and is the founder of “From Words to Wok”; a community for people who to love to read and eat!

name: Don't Stop Acting 2.0 - Acting Workshop
description:
Atta Galatta and MWM MOVIES cordially invite you to the latest Acting Workshop in town. 
Join fellow aspiring actors and actresses for an inspiring session of learning acting through basics at our Writers Club Meet event in the cozy ambiance of the library cafe. Our Acting workshop is designed for aspiring artists who wish to explore the fundamentals of acting and develop their performance skills in a supportive and engaging environment. This immersive workshop offers participants a thorough grounding in acting techniques, character development, and scene work, providing them with the tools needed to bring authenticity and depth to their performances.
Who Should Attend?
This workshop is ideal for beginners with little to no acting experience, as well as intermediate actors looking to refresh their skills. It is also suitable for anyone interested in improving their public speaking and presentation abilities.
Workshop Objectives:
- To introduce participants to the basic principles of acting.
- To develop participants` abilities to create believable and compelling characters.
- To enhance participants` skills in scene study and script analysis.
- To build participants` confidence in performing in front of an audience.
Key Components involves learning theory and practicals of: 
- Acting Techniques
- Character Development and Analysis
- SCript Analysis and Interpretation
- Understanding Director`s Vision
- Conveying Emotions
- Physicality and Movement of Camera
- Improvization and Spontaneity
- Voice and Diction
- Working with Props and Costumes
- Rehearsals and Performances
What does it entail:
- Involving in an ice breaker extravagant game.
- Participating in workshop with enthusiasm.
- Following community guidelines.
Community Guidelines:
- Be open, be civil, be courteous, be kind, and have fun.
- Listen more. Speak mindfully.
- No monopolizing the conversation.
Disclaimer on Event Coverage:
- Event highlights will be captured through photos and videos for showcasing the event in our social media accounts.
- All Event media will be shared with the participants upon request.

name: Noor Inayat Khan - Theatre Performance
description: The play - Noor is a reconstruction of the story of Noor Inayat Khan, a direct descendant of Tipu Sultan, who served in Britain’s Special Operations during World War II. It is an extraordinary tale of devotion to duty, resilience in the face of Nazi oppression in France. A fascinating life of a woman who defied all labels in her own quiet way - daughter of a Sufi pacifist who joined the war yet didn`t want to kill anyone, an Indian origin woman who served a country that colonised India, a demure looking woman with extraordinary inner strength. Her story is brought to life as a ‘Courtyard Theatre’ production, a format developed by BLT. A team of two actors who play different characters with very minimal props and sets, lights and sounds.

name: Manga Mochas 1.0 - Manga and Comics Fan Meet
description:
Atta Galatta and Your View on Books, Novel Club cordially invite you to the unique Manga Mochas, a fans meet for Comics & Manga readers.
Are you a Manga maven or a comic connoisseur? Have you ever wanted to share your passion, connect with like-minded enthusiasts, and debate the finer points of your favorite stories? Well, your wait is over!
Calling all voracious readers of Manga, comics, and graphic novels! Join us for an exhilarating in-person meet-up where you can express YOUR views, discuss your beloved series, and meet fellow aficionados!
What does it entail?
- Involving in an ice breaker extravagant game.
- Sharing your views on favorite books.
- Participating in the curated discussion.
- Voting for a Monthly Book Read.
- Following community guidelines.
 
Community Guidelines:
- Be open, be civil, be courteous, be kind, and have fun.
- Listen more. Speak mindfully.
- No monopolising the conversation.
Event Sections:
1. Icebreaker Extravaganza: Kick things off with a fun game and introduce yourself. Let`s warm up the crowd!
2. Manga Mochas: Step into the spotlight for 5-7 minutes and share your passion for your favorite Manga or comic. No slides, just pure enthusiasm!
INTERMISSION: Chill & Chat
3. Fun & Games: Prepare for laughs with another engaging game.
4. What’s Next? Discuss and vote on the next Manga, comic, or graphic novel we’ll dive into!
5. Special Surprise Activity: Stay tuned for an exciting twist!
6. Photo Op: Say "cheese" for our group picture!
Curated Books for Discussion on Monthly Reads:
- The Maus Chapter I (Graphic Novel) by Art Spigelman
- Batman Year One (Comics) by Frank Miller
- Rave Master (Manga) by Hiro Mashima
- Saga Volume One (Comics) by Brian K. Vaughan
- Palestine (Graphic Novel) by Joe Sacco
- Noragami Volume 1 (Manga) by Adachitoka
Disclaimer on Event Coverage:
- Event highlights will be captured through photos and videos for showcasing the event in our social media accounts.
- All Event media will be shared with the participants upon request.

name: Junior Detectives: Mystery Hunters - Session
description:
So you want to be a detective? Do you love reading mystery books? Then put on your thinking caps and get your magnifying glasses ready!
- Create your own secret codes
- Learn about fingerprints
- Test your observation skills
-Find clues and solve a mystery
All participants get one free copy of The Egghead Detective Agency Vol. 1!
Pika Nani is a children’s author based in Bengaluru. Her popular titles include, The Egghead Detective Agency Vol 1 and 2, an interactive chapter book with two little girls and a ghost detective. The Adventures of Shrilok Homeless Vol 1 & 2, an Indian version of Sherlock Holmes set in Mumbai. Little Indians: Stories from across the country, a bestselling fact plus fiction book. Five of her stories appear in school text books by Orient Blackswan and Macmillan.

name: Pichwai Art Workshop - Art Workshop
description:
Come, let’s celebrate Krishna and his Leelas through the beautiful art form of Pichwai Paintings. It is a traditional art form that dates back to the 16th century from the city of Nathdwara, Rajasthan. These paintings portray Krishna (Srinath ji) and his leelas through bright and vivid colours.
Pichwai means backdrops, these paintings were used as backdrops mainly in Srinathji Temple at Nathdwara. The paintings are a way for us to connect with the Lord Krishna.
This art is soul-satisfying and divine, another art form to start with your basic art skill. You need no prior knowledge of drawing or painting in order to attend this workshop.
NO TRACING OR COPYING, you will be drawing on your own.
Srinathji will be taught in this workshop and some of the required basic pichwai motifs.
Note: All the materials will be provided by the host.
What will you take home?
Knowledge of Indian Art Culture
Learn an ancient art form
Completed piece of artwork done by yourself
What do you need to bring?
Water bottle to keep you hydrated.
This workshop includes all materials, if required kindly get an Examination Pad / Paper Board also maybe a pro circle if available.

name: Secrets of  Sari Storytelling - Immersive Styling Workshop
description:
Like Bill Waterson-Calvin’s SpaceMan Spiff, if you too nurture an alter ego of becoming a sari storyteller, attend this session. It discusses tips and techniques to refine your sari styling and fashion storytelling. Okay, it does not promise to turn you into a chic sensation overnight, but it can make you mindful of telling your sari style story by managing your fashion image for the world. You can apply the learning to daily life. NOTE: The workshop is for a limited number of participants. We request you to register accordingly. Please carry a sari you love or dislike, your fave journal, and a pen.
OBJECTIVES

To help you express your sari fashion identity in a safe circle of listeners.
To help you know the ground rules of mindful sari styling for SELF.
To help you learn the basics of sari story writing for SELF (read: for social media).

FACILITATOR
The session is conducted by Bhawana Pingali, former Fashion Features Editor of FEMINA (Worldwide Media Ltd.—Times of India / BBC Magazines). She is a mother of a teen, has been an editor-educator for the last 19+ years, and is currently authoring a book with PENGUIN. Her articles have appeared in The Hindu, Hindustan Times-Mint Lounge, Time Out, Lonely Planet, Travel + Leisure, Maxim, Orissa Post, Signature-Oman, among others. She has taught at NIFT, Pearl Academy, Symbiosis Institute of Design, CEPT-Ahmedabad, IIM-A, British Council (TEFL-certified trainer), GD Goenka and Ansal Universities. Her heart now lies in teaching yoga, and reviving saris and rituals through fashion research lab REVASTRA.
